unreleased:e84943ee101d:
Here's a summary of all **13 unreleased changelog entries**:

---

## Unreleased Changes — Summary

### Changelog Infrastructure Fixes (4 entries)
| ID | Summary |
|---|---|
| CHG-52face3a | Release rollover now preserves version summaries and reliably resets unreleased state |
| CHG-52face3a-1 | Backfilled missing v0.7.0 and v0.8.0 history; aligned unreleased entries with post-release state |
| CHG-52face3a-2 | Normalized archive summary cache keys to hash-based format; removed legacy prefix fallback |
| CHG-52face3a-3 | Rebuilt all version summaries using deterministic grouped summarization backend |

### Release Workflow Improvements (3 entries)
| ID | Summary |
|---|---|
| CHG-471f2512 | Added `--skip-prepare` dispatch-only mode to avoid redundant pre-release runs |
| CHG-471f2512-1 | Streamlined VS Code task picker with favorites, `[fav]` labels, and input-driven release prompts |
| CHG-471f2512-2 | Fixed release preview to label output as "Unreleased" instead of current version number |

### LLM Backend & Config Refactoring (6 entries)
| ID | Summary |
|---|---|
| CHG-471f2512-3 | Moved changelog/release LLM runtime defaults to config; removed hardcoded model assumptions |
| CHG-471f2512-4 | Switched LLM flows to CLI-only backends (`claude-cli`/`codex`); removed Anthropic API fallback |
| CHG-471f2512-5 | Split delegation config from changelog config; added prompt/runtime controls to changelog config |
| CHG-471f2512-6 | Refactored changelog config into per-backend sections (`codex`, `claude_cli`, `intelligent`) |
| CHG-471f2512-7 | Simplified to a single shared `timeout_seconds` setting; removed per-backend timeout fields |
| CHG-471f2512-8 | Moved `delegation-config.json` to `scripts/`; untracked generated `CHANGELOG.md` and summaries |

---

**Tags represented:** `Bug Fix` · `Code Refactoring` · `Build / Packaging` · `Documentation Update` · `Configuration Cleanup` · `UI Improvement`

**Date range:** All entries dated 2026-02-22
unreleased:f7e86a4101d0:
This update focuses on making changelog and release notes generation more reliable and consistent while simplifying configuration and streamlining developer workflows. It also adds a preview changelog to review upcoming changes before a release.

### New Features
- Add a changelog preview file with an Unreleased section for quick pre‑release review.

### Bug Fixes
- Release rollovers now keep the correct summaries and reset the Unreleased state properly.
- Preview release notes are clearly labeled “Unreleased” when not stamping a version.
- The published changelog shows only released versions; Unreleased work no longer appears in the markdown.
- Every stamped release now gets a summary even if no prior preview was generated, preventing empty or partial sections.
- Archived versions consistently display full summaries instead of shortened fallbacks.

### Improvements
- Clearer, smarter release summaries that group similar changes and avoid repetition.
- Faster releases with a dispatch‑only path when a preview is already prepared.
- Cleaner editor task picker with favorites and fewer redundant entries.
- More dependable local tooling by standardizing on command‑line tools and increasing timeouts for long runs.
- Simplified configuration: tool settings are centralized, organized by tool where helpful, and use a single shared timeout.
- Less repository noise by ignoring generated changelog artifacts and tracking only the source files.
- Packaging updates ensure summary data is included so summaries carry over correctly during releases.

### Documentation
- Restored missing v0.7.0 and v0.8.0 history and aligned the Unreleased list with current post‑release work.
- Expanded configuration guidance with examples for choosing tools and timeouts.
- Regenerated the changelog so released history renders consistently.
unreleased:66a7efea7f86:
## Unreleased

This update focuses on making changelog and release‑note generation more reliable and predictable. It fixes rollover and stamping issues, streamlines configuration and workflows, and adds a preview to review upcoming changes.

### New Features
- Changelog preview file to review pending changes before a release.

### Bug Fixes
- Preserve version summaries during release rollover and reset the unreleased state correctly.
- Always stamp releases with a matching summary, promoting the unreleased text when available or generating one when missing.
- Match summaries to the correct version to avoid incorrect or duplicated text.
- Archived releases now render complete summaries consistently (no legacy fallbacks).
- Default previews are labeled “Unreleased” instead of a version number.
- Published changelog shows released history only, keeping unreleased items out of the markdown.

### Improvements
- Cleaner, grouped release summaries that avoid repeated entries.
- Simpler, config‑driven settings for how summaries and release notes are generated.
- More predictable builds by standardizing how version summaries are stored and cleaned up.
- Faster release workflow with an option to dispatch a release when a preview already exists.
- Automation now includes the data needed for accurate summaries while ignoring generated files.
- Streamlined VS Code task picker with favorites and parameterized workflows; terminal uses the workspace Python by default.
- More reliable local tooling for generating release text, with longer timeouts for large inputs.

### Documentation
- Backfilled the missing v0.7.0 and v0.8.0 history and aligned the unreleased section with the post‑release state.
- Documented configuration options and the new preview workflow; rebuilt the markdown changelog to reflect the latest history.
